relation: Great for these types of students
-People who enjoy smaller groups. -People who want a small class size where professors know them personally. -People who seek professional development. -People who place high importance on service.

If at all possible, bring a car. Public transportation isn't very reliable, and the school is very secluded from many fun places. The closest Wal-Mart is about 4 miles away. Doable, but you might not want to carry your groceries that far. Also, GET INVOLVED. It is one of the best ways to meet new people and have something to do. Service is a big deal here, so many classes will require you to do community service in order to pass. Make sure you do it, and go to all mandatory events or you will get additional service hours. If you want a bigger school, this is not the place for you. It is a great school, but very quiet and small. Be aware that their is a mandatory attendance policy for classes. If you miss 6 hours or more, you fail the course. Not all professors follow this policy, but most do.

I have found Barry University to be a wonderful investment. If you aren't serious about your career just yet, and are looking to party more, then you might not want to spend as much money here. Tuition is expensive, but Barry is very good about giving financial aid, especially if you do well in high school.

While some people hate how small the college is, I love it. I have found the staff to be very helpful, and the school hosts lots of events such as dances and trips off campus, many of which are free. The dorms are your typical college dorms. The food gets old after a while, but again, that's part of the college experience.

Most of the professors are very invested in their students, and will help you outside of class with anything you need. I am a member of the Honors Program, and the HP classes are very interesting, especially PHI 191. If you are willing to work hard and study you can learn a lot.

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Alexandra from Miami, FL 12/29/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 12 out of 13 people found this review useful. 2 of 106 Categories Comments Great for these types of students For students wanting to be in the medical field, broadcasting field, arts, or business field. For students that like to network, and meet people from all over. For students that want to be part of a community, who really want to belong. For students that really like extracurricular activities, like those in the entertainment field. For students that like to work hard. For students that like to have fun. For students who want to be great. For students who want their dreams to become a reality. Tips for prospective students Be prepared to have a lot of fun because the school has a lot of extracurricular activities to do, whether it be intramural sports, modeling, modern dancing, or trying out for the step team. Also go to class everyday, do your work on time, and essays ahead of time so you won't
